an5.9:1.1: “Mendicants, a disrespectful and irreverent mendicant with five qualities fails, and doesn’t establish themselves in the true teaching.
an5.9:1.3: A disrespectful and irreverent mendicant who is faithless …
an5.9:1.7: witless fails, and doesn’t establish themselves in the true teaching.
an5.9:1.8: A disrespectful and irreverent mendicant with these five qualities fails, and doesn’t establish themselves in the true teaching.
an5.9:2.1: A respectful and reverent mendicant with five qualities doesn’t fail, and establishes themselves in the true teaching.
an5.9:2.3: A respectful and reverent mendicant who is faithful …
an5.9:2.7: wise doesn’t fail, and establishes themselves in the true teaching.
an5.9:2.8: A respectful and reverent mendicant with these five qualities doesn’t fail, and establishes themselves in the true teaching.”
